fields.description:
As a user I would like to be able to create variables in Bitbucket Pipelines at a project level.

This would allow repositories within a project to share values, without polluting team-level variables with values that are specific to a project.

fields.description:

This is a ticket to track progress around planning for improving filtering to allow users to focus on particular kinds of events in the feed, such as comments, commits, tasks, etc. 

!image-2019-12-19-18-21-30-728.png!

!image-2020-03-22-15-32-43-430.png|width=360,height=591!
fields.summary: Add Filters to Activity Feed

fields.description:
This is a public ticket to track our progress on adding back comment-based tasks back to the new PR ui. We expect this work to be done by beginning of January 2020

 

!image-2019-12-19-18-14-59-578.png!
fields.summary: Add comment-attached tasks back to new UI

fields.description:
This ticket tracks our progress on adding back Image Diffs to the new pull request UI. 

  !image-2020-03-22-15-43-08-103.png|width=459,height=281!
fields.summary: Add Image Diffs back to new Pull Request UI

fields.description:
This is a public ticket to track our work on porting over Merge Checklists to the new pull request user interface. We're about 85% done with the work, and expect it to be completed by the end of February 2020. 

 

!image-2019-12-19-17-45-42-565.png!

fields.description:
This is a tracking ticket for our users to see the status of adding back 'Likes' functionality into the new pull request experience. We appreciate that users really want the ability to easily acknowledge feedback from each other without having to add additional comments, and we're making it a priority to have this work done soon. 

!image-2019-12-19-17-40-10-803.png!
fields.summary: Add Likes back to the new Pull Request UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When applying the code formatting on a word on Bitbucket's new editor, it randomly changes characters on the text as single quotes.

For example: "test app" is changed to "test 'pp" after clicking on the code formatting buttom.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a comment in a pull request or add a comment to an issue on the issue tracker
# Type some text.
# Highlight a word of the text.
# Click the three dots to format the highlighted word and choose "Code"

h3. Expected Results
The word selected is formatted as code

h3. Actual Results
The word selected is formatted as code and random characters from the text are changed to single quotes

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Setting a word as `code` on Bitbucket editor makes it swap random characters as to single quotes

fields.description:
If possible, please create a feature to prevent repositories from being deleted by mistake.
Although we already have a message pop up previous to  repository deletion, it would be nice to have a second layer of security.
fields.summary: Create a repository lock feature to prevent repository deletion

fields.description:
I might have been able to review all the changes in my feature branch using Compare _BEFORE_ merging into master and pushing to Bitbucket, but now that I've done so I'm unable to review the merge as a single diff in SourceTree or in Bitbucket Cloud.

The commit view lists all my feature branch commits as commits in master now, and there is no "Merge into master" commit to be found.

I suggest you allow comparing branches at respective points in history, not just compare the latest. Or show merge into master commits so the whole merge can be reviewed after the fact.
fields.summary: Can't review whole diff of merge into master

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
We observes that when we have stacked notifications or when the user goes offline. The notifications don't show completely on the browser

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Step 1: Login into bitbucket cloud
Step 2: Disconnect the Wifi or Refresh the page and when it's about to load disconnect the wifi
Step 3: You will get a notification that the "You are offline" as shown in the screenshot

h3. Expected Results
The notification should be completely visible.

h3. Actual Results
The notification pops, but the notification on the UI doesn't show-up completely.

h3. Workaround
You would need to acknowledge the other stacked notifications
Sometimes this works and brings the notification up and makes it visible
fields.summary: Stacked notifications and offline notifications don't show completely on browser UI

fields.description:
The actual limit of 50 webhooks per repository is not fitting to customer necessities. 

As webhooks have been leveraged as a CI/CD feature, with automation via provided REST APIs, the limit should be higher.
fields.summary: Increase webhooks limit per repository

fields.description:
In the past, Bitbucket Cloud used to announce major changes in a terminal screen when someone clones a repository via Git.

*Feature Request:*
I believe it will be useful if we could have this feature to allow customers to customize this terminal annoucement when someone clones their owned repository. Probably something they can set on a per repo basis.
fields.summary: Git Terminal Announcement Feature

fields.description:
*Summary:*
When users create a branch from a Jira redirected screen onto Bitbucket. Also, if there are already existing branches (as all branches user has access to get's listed). The UI takes some amount of time or there is an additional delay that is experienced by the users.

As & when the user inputs her/his keystrokes Bitbucket goes about looking for the branches with the corresponding keys causing the UI to stall for a few seconds.

*Suggestions:*
1. Avoid blocking all the form field when something is changed in one field and validate form when create button is clicked.
2. Delay the validations on each keystroke, so the user can complete the typing
3. Decrease the response time of validation, right now it is taking more time to search for from branch
fields.summary: Creating Branch from Jira redirected screen takes long

fields.description:
h3. Feature Summary

"Join Sites" feature is being implemented to allow individual Bitbucket Cloud users to join Jira software sites that are relevant to the account.
h3. Feature Request

Since there's no option for organization admin to manage their users' access to external sites, it will be best that there's an option for organization admin to disable the "Join Sites" feature for their organization users.

fields.description: Currently, NFC only supports OTP as their key which we don't support so it would be great to support this as well in Bitbucket 2SV authentication.
fields.summary: Support NFC OTP key

I am sure there were other issues but did notice on at least 2 buttons that if you were directly over button text it would not show as a clickable button but if you moved to the edge of the button it would

Typing into the repo search in Firefox is very sluggish

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open repo search in the sidebar
 # Start typing

h3. Expected Results

The input box keeps up with my typing

h3. Actual Results

The text lags far behind.

h3. Workaround

Wait.

fields.description:
Summary :

Currently, there is no API available for creating a link between the repositories and other applications. The feature is available over the UI. A new API endpoint could be added to achieve the same.

Reason for request:

1. Achieve automation for linking the repositories with other applications.

2. Retrieve the information on existing links could be required for audit/reporting.

fields.description:
I would like to be able to mark comments as resolved in the PR view.

Ideally there would be some indicator if there are unresolved comments as well, and resolved comments can be hidden / less prominent.
fields.summary: Resolve comments on pull request

fields.description:
Currently, our workflow includes two types of builds:
# Pipelines builds that are set up to check the code quality.
# Pipelines builds that are set up to test our software.

We always run both and, even though the "test builds" run successfully our "code quality builds" can fail and, due to the feature "Check the last commit for at least x successful build and no failed builds" we are not able to merge our changes.

We would like to request this functionality to be slipt in two:
# Check the last commit for at least x successful build
# Check the last commit for no failed builds

For now, we are using as a workaround the API call [to update the build status|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D/statuses/build/%7Bkey%7D] to Successful but we would really appreciate have this option split.
fields.summary: Split Merge Checks feature

fields.description: Would love to be able to use the keyboard shortcuts to quickly navigate between pull requests.  I typically review multiple PRs at once and navigating through them is very inefficient.
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts if Pull Requests

fields.description:
Bitbucket should have support to SSH Keys certificate auth.

SSH [has a specification|https://cvsweb.openbsd.org/src/usr.bin/ssh/PROTOCOL.certkeys?annotate=HEAD] that defines support for SSH certificates. 
SSH certificates allow one SSH key to sign another SSH key, resulting in an “SSH certificate”. A server that trusts the CA is able to verify the certificate’s signature and trust the certificate and its associated metadata.

How does it work?
1- Organization uploads a SSH CA.
2- Individual SSH keys are signed by SSH CA.
3- Resulting certificate can be used to access organization repos. Bitbucket should identify the developer accessing the repository based on the “login@bitbucket.com” certificate extension, which must be included.


Ref. [https://github.blog/2019-08-14-ssh-certificate-authentication-for-github-enterprise-cloud/]
fields.summary: Support SSH Certificate Authentication

fields.description:
Currently Bitbucket Cloud's branch permission only allows wildcards for branch names. 

It would be a useful feature if there could be a possibility to create a branch permission matched by RegEx expressions.
fields.summary: Allow to use RegEx expressions for Branch permissions

fields.description: It would be a useful feature if a Pull Request could be declined If either the last build of the last commit of the PR or the build of the PR itself fails
fields.summary: Decline a Pull Request once the build fails

fields.description:
Please bring back a way to see all comments in a PR as some PRs are extremely long and it can be difficult to find the comments - something similar to the old view would be great to see.

 

Key words: 
 * Activity Feed
 * Activity Tab
 * Comment tracking
 * New PR UI
 * Old PR
 * old pull request
 * new pull request
fields.summary: Ability to view all comments in a PR in the new view

fields.description:
At the moment the diff view distinguishes changes with green (Changes added) and red (Changes removed) highlights.

Some users who are color blind have a harder time identifying changes because the colors are indistinguishable to them. 

Can we improve the view diff view experience by including colors that are easily distinguishable for colorblind users? 

At the moment, the only identifier for colorblind users is the + for changes added and - for changes removed.
fields.summary: Improve diff view to accommodate colorblind users

fields.description:
Bitbucket pipelines (BBPL) have names. "default", "branch: master", or "my-custom". Here is how they *all* look in BBPL:

!image-2019-12-12-07-45-50-132.png!

This pipeline has actually started the staging frontend microservice.

Suggestion:

In the screenshot above it would be good to see the name of the executed pipeline. (See below. Sorry for my awful drawing skills.)

!image-2019-12-12-07-53-29-694.png!

fields.description:
Team,
To avoid confusion on our users, I've noticed that inside the part of "Change Plan" on Bitbucket Cloud, when you select the Country, the part to insert the State/Province is a Textbox, which does not indicate how the user should put his State/Province. 

I would suggest implementing a dropdown, that when the user select the country, automatically the States of that Country would be populated on the dropdown, avoiding any kind of confusion. 

Here is the ticket that I've used as a reference to open this suggestion:
- https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/CA-870536

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a new issue in Bitbucket, if you add double quotes in the issue description and save it, these are converted to smart quotes

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the repository issues page and click on "Create Issue"
# On the description of the issue add double quotes
#* eg. {code}"foobar" testing quotes{code}
# The double quotes will be converted to smart quotes

h3. Expected Results

The issue should display:
{code}"foobar" testing quotes{code}

h3. Actual Results

{code}"foobar" testing quotes{code}

h3. Workaround

If possible, add the "double-quoted" text inside a "code" format box as text inside the code boxes is not converted/modified by markdown.

(i) The code text box can be added by:
# The "code snippet" in the issue panel
# Three smart single quotes " ``` "
# Ctrl/Cmd + shift + M
fields.summary: After saving a new issue in Bitbucket, double quotes are converted to smart quotes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to post a comment on a pull request, or a issue, or a commit and this comment has a table in it, removing the table's header prevents the comment from being posted. If the table header is removed from a table on the description of an issue or pull request, the table gets removed uppon saving

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new issue on Bitbucket's issue tracker
# Add a title to the issue
# Add a table to the issue's description, remove the table first line and populate the table
# Create the issue

https://share.getcloudapp.com/d5uezkNw

h3. Expected Results
* The issue is created with a table on its description

h3. Actual Results
* The issue is created with an empty description

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removing a table header on Bitbucket's editor breaks the editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A "Something went wrong" error appears in UI with the "New pull request experience" Labs feature enabled if the pull request difference is very large, so that it's processing time is very close to timeout thresholds. The PR might sometimes load and other times not, depending on the time of day (load on the server), local network conditions, or other factors. The network interactions for the page show a 555 response code for the PR diff request.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a large Pull Request with "New pull request experience" Labs feature enabled.
 # "Something went wrong" may appear depending on size of PR diff, network conditions, and time of day.

h3. Expected Results

Pull request should display the diff between branches of the PR.
h3. Actual Results

Error message "Something went wrong" in UI with new pull request experience, and 555 response code in Network tab.
h3. Workaround

Review the PR using the old pull request experience.

To return to the old pull request experience for all PRs:
 # Click on your avatar icon in the lower left corner of any Bitbucket page.
 # Select *Bitbucket Labs*.
 # Disable "New Pull request experience" feature.
 # Enable "Old Pull request experience" feature.

If Old PR has some issue, Please review the PR locally using git diff command and merge either locally or through UI.
fields.summary: Error "Something went wrong" when using "New pull request experience" Labs feature

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using the Bitbucket diff tool, if you try to search for changes in the code that are highlighted, no results are retrieved.

(x) Affects: Google Chrome
(/) Works: Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a file with "foo" as its content and push it to Bitbucket
# Edit the file to "foobar"
# Check the side-by-side diff view and try to search for "foobar"

h3. Expected Results

"foobar" should be highlighted and found.

h3. Actual Results

You can find either "foo" and "bar" but not "foobar".

h3. Workaround

Use a different browser such as the ones listed in the "Works" list above (Safari).
fields.summary: Searching for changes in the code while using the diff does not show results

For Bitbucket session to remain active unless user logs out
h3. Actual Results

Users are getting randomly logged out 
h3. Workaround

Log back into Bitbucket account to continue the work and access data.

fields.description:

Table copied from Salesforce is not rendered correctly in the comment section of a PR
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy the table from Salesforce (screenshot 1)
 # And paste it in the comments section of the pull request and save it.
 # The table is not rendered correctly.
 # *Case 1:* Copy any two rows of the table without the header, paste it in the pull request comment and save it. The content is not displayed in a table format. Refer screenshot 2
 # *Case 2:* Copy any two rows of the table with the header, paste it in the pull request comment and save it. The content is displayed in a table format, however the column is rendered incorrectly. Refer to screenshot 3

h3. Expected Results

The table should be rendered exactly like the original table
h3. Actual Results

The table format is not correct.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table copied from Salesforce is not rendered correctly in the comment section of a PR

Rest API required to retrieve the issue ids directly from pull requests.

fields.description:

fields.description:

When executing a Pipelines build from the builds page (addon/pipelines/home), if you hit the _go back one page_ browser button as soon as the build page loads, Bitbucket UI will not update the build status.

# As soon as the build page starts loading (https://bitbucket.org/<username>/<repo_slug>/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/<build_number>), go back one page through the browser.

https://share.getcloudapp.com/xQu0pPDY

fields.description:
{panel:title= Implementation of New Features Policy|titleBGColor=#e0efff}
At the moment, we can't set an ETA for this feature to be released, since there's a number of factors that determine how our product team prioritizes new features. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
 You can learn more by reading [Implementation of New Features Policy|https://confluence.atlassian.com/support/implementation-of-new-features-policy-201294576.html].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Bitbucket repositories don't have unique ID hence the user is unable to create repositories with the same name even if it's on different projects because all repositories are accessed within the level of workspace. As [Bitbucket Server|https://docs.atlassian.com/bitbucket-server/javadoc/7.6.0/api/com/atlassian/bitbucket/repository/Repository.html] guarantees the repository name to be unique per project, this constraint impedes the server-to-cloud migration.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the users to maintain the uniqueness of repository names per project.
h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of this feature request moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: Ability to create repositories with the same name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary I'm writing a script that creates a PR or updates an existing PR for a specific user. To make the choice on creating or updating the script needs to check for an existing PR for a specific user that is open. When using the `/2.0/repositories/\{owner}/\{repo_slug}/pullrequests` to pull a list of open pull requests, I pass the `state` and `q` query parameters to filter out any PR's that aren't open or are not created by a specific user. Unfortunately the `state` query parameter isn't respected and PR's that aren't open are returned. I tried including `state` in the `q` parameter as well but that was still returning the incorrect pull requests. h3. Steps to Reproduce # You can run curl on a repo such as `https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/staff-avatar/pullrequests?q=author.username+%3D+%22tap-bot%22&state=OPEN` ## Alternatively you can do any repo that has had a PR merged (or leave the open state in any way) and then query for that user's PR's that are open h3. Expected Results A list of PR's that are in the state that is specified in the query parameter or the query argument. h3. Actual Results The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file: Not an exception but this is the results that are returned for curling the above URL. {noformat} {"pagelen": 10, "values": [{"description": "Some dependencies have been automatically updated for this repository. The following packages were not able to be updated because they contain a major version bump that might not be backwards compatible. ├────────────────────────────────────┼─────────┼────────┤ │ @storybook/channels (dev) │ 4.1.18 │ 5.2.6 │ ├────────────────────────────────────┼─────────┼────────┤ │ @storybook/react (dev) │ 4.1.18 │ 5.2.6 │ ├────────────────────────────────────┼─────────┼────────┤ │ @types/storybook__addon-info (dev) │ 4.1.2 │ 5.2.1 │ ├────────────────────────────────────┼─────────┼────────┤ │ @types/storybook__react (dev) │ 4.0.2 │ 5.2.0 │ ├────────────────────────────────────┼─────────┼────────┤ │ styled-components (dev) │ 3.4.10 │ 4.4.1 │ └────────────────────────────────────┴─────────┴────────┘ ``` ", "links": {"decline": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/staff-avatar/pullrequests/10/decline"}, "diffstat": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/staff-avatar/diffstat/atlassian/staff-avatar:360e7f0321bc%0D0424f8599d09?from_pullrequest_id=10"}, "commits": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/staff-avatar/pullrequests/10/commits"}, "self": {"href": "https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/atlassian/staff-avatar/pullrequests/10"}, When a user performs a re-write history event, this information is not sent to Jira, which can cause some confusion related to the sync of the two platforms. 

Currently, the only way to see the up to date information in Jira is to force a manual re-sync from the backend.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket Trello Power-Up displays builds as ‘Successful’ even there are multiple builds and some have failed.

Example PR: [https://bitbucket.org/trello/server/pull-requests/4803/abstract-aa-finish-and-unlink/diff] 

Incorrectly displaying the PR build as green could lead to broken code being merged, causing errors in production.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Trello board with Bitbucket Cloud Power-Up enabled.
 # With a Bitbucket Cloud PR that has one red and one green build (in this case, one test suite run and one translations build job)
 # Attach the PR link to a Trello card.

h3. Expected Results

PULL REQUEST STATUS 1/2 (orange? red?)

The PR attachment should be listed as ‘Failing’ or ‘mixed’ or something other than ‘Successful’
h3. Actual Results

PULL REQUEST STATUS 1/1 (green)

Attachment shown with a green ‘Successful’ badge
h3. Workaround

Ignore what's displayed in Trello, click through to the PR and view the build status there. Kinda defeats the point of the Power-Up.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Trello Power-Up displays builds as ‘Successful’ even when some have failed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you try to push to a repository whereby the account exceeds the user limit, it shows the error that your team has exceeded the limit. 

However, the URL which is being suggested is incorrect as it is supposed to show the Team Account instead of the personal account. 

In this case, it could lead to unknowingly, upgrading the personal account. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a team account which is above the User Limit.
 # Perform a push to any of the repositories in that team account

h3. Expected Results

The URL in the error should be pointing towards a Team Account Plans/Billing page. 

h3. Actual Results
The URL points to towards the Personal Account Plans/Billing page. 

{code}
$ git push origin mybranch --force
Enter passphrase for key '/Users/test/.ssh/testssh': 

********************************************************************************
[ALERT] Your push failed because the account 'PravinTeam' has exceeded its
[ALERT] user limit and this repository is restricted to read-only access.
[ALERT] Change your plan to restore write access:
[ALERT] https://bitbucket.org/account/user/pravin/plans
********************************************************************************
 
{code}

h3. Workaround

* Navigate to your team account settings directly and access the plans page. 
* Another method is to access the URL directly after replacing the <username> with your team account username. 
** {code}
https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<username>/plans
{code}
fields.summary: Push to a repository that the account exceeds user limit, shows URL to personal account instead of team account to upgrade plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User unable to update the full name on Bitbucket profile.

User tried to change the full name using Atlassian account profile, but the name resets to the original name on gmail after logout and login again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to Bitbucket.org, goto Bitbucket settings and goto Atlassian account. Update the full name. After refreshing, the name does gets updated on the Bitbucket account.
 # Logout from the account, goto bitbucket.org. Click on Login, select the login option through gmail as shown in the screenshot. After login, the username gets updated to the one in the gmail account. 

h3. Expected Results

The Full name in the Bitbucket account shouldn't be changed even after Logout and login.
h3. Actual Results
The full name gets reset with the name in gmail when logged in using gmail account using the option provided in the screenshot.

h3. Workaround
User should enter the credentials manually to be able to login without using the auto prompted account on the browser.
fields.summary: User unable to update the full name on the Bitbucket cloud profile

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Changeset comments on issues are being interpreted as Markdown.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Bitbucket Issues seem to be using a Markdown parser.
 # When making a commit, add a commit message. When it comes in the commit message screen, the syntax is normal, but if this is lined to an issue, the commit message that comes up in a comments section loses its syntax.

The syntax is only maintained if 
 1. The users explicitly uses the markdown syntax (if making the changes in the Bitbucket UI commit messages)
 2. If using CLI, pressing Return/Enter twice will generate a new line (in a VI editor)
h3. Expected Results

When the commit message in the commit screen of the Bitbucket UI shows the Line breaks, then the same should be applicable to the Issues section of Bitbucket UI as well, specifically the comments under the issue.
 The issue screen should look similar to the commits screen as below;

!image-2019-12-03-16-13-47-221.png!
h3. Actual Results

The line breaks are lost in the comments on issues, and hence the information looks jumbled.
 !image-2019-12-03-16-14-01-592.png!
h3. Workaround

A workaround is available if the merge is done manually;
 "In Markdown syntax, you need to end a line with 2 spaces for the next line to be registered, for example, here I have two spaces at the end of each line.
 If you put the message in a CLI locally, then press enter twice at the end of the line to indicate a line break."

*BUT, this workaround will not work in an environment where merge commits are automater or one where the user does not have control over the formatting of commit. Re-formatting already pushed commit messages and force-pushing them again would create a lot of problems for the users who have already pulled the commits and commited on top of them.* 

There is a feature request in place already to get this up and running, but some immediate workaround is necessary for the customer till the feature request is implemented, Hence raising this as a bug request.

Kindly Assist
 Regards
 Manu Abraham
fields.summary: rendering commit messages in issue changeset comments as markdown

fields.description:
Hello,

Currently, there is no option to download files through an API by setting a MIME type. 

I am trying to use a bitbucket repository as a helm chart repository; Please refer to:

[https://medium.com/@mattiaperi/create-a-public-helm-chart-repository-with-github-pages-49b180dbb417]
 [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Helm-repository/qaq-p/1022537#M49562]

The file is being set to the wrong mime type on download, so helm when it uses it can not unpack it and has an error

`Error: gzip: invalid header`

 

After downloading, the file format is set to other than the actual format of the file.
fields.summary: Option to set MIME type for downloading files through API calls

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Syntax highlighting doesn't work properly for source files in a few languages (like Groovy, DART, Jypyter, *update* Shell ) on the Bitbucket UI.

Bitbucket Cloud UI use Monaco-editor which caters to a wide range of languages and is yet to cover a few more and can be found in the link below: [https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/.|https://microsoft.github.io/monaco-editor/]

The source files written in a language not supported by Monaco editor will not do Syntax highlighting in Bitbucket UI.

However, editing the file in Bitbucket UI can do the Syntax highlighting as Editor use CodeMirror - [https://codemirror.net/mode/index.html] which does support a different set of language than Monaco editor
h3. Steps to Reproduce

View file in Bitbucket UI and observe Syntax highlighting 

h3. Actual Results

The syntax is not highlighted while checking the source file on the Bitbucket UI

h3. Expected Results

The syntax be highlighted while checking the files on the Bitbucket UI regardless of the page

h3. Workaround:

Check the file whiles using the "edit" mode
fields.summary: Syntax Highlighting doesn't work in Bitbucket UI for few languages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

By default, Bitbucket profile details are public and anyone who is not logged in can see the team members and public projects.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Team in Bitbucket.
 # Under the Team Settings, the "Hide Bitbucket profile details" checkbox is unchecked by default.
 # Hence anyone who is not logged in can see the team members and public projects.

h3. Expected Results

The "Hide Bitbucket profile details" checkbox should be checked by default. This makes the Bitbucket profile private by default.
h3. Actual Results

The Bitbucket profile is public by default. Anyone who is not logged in can see the team members and public projects by accessing the below URLs

Example:

[https://bitbucket.org/planetbreezycloude/profile/projects]
 [https://bitbucket.org/planetbreezycloude/profile/members]
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: By default Bitbucket profile details are public

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

At this time, if a user clones another repository from the same workspace in pipelines with IP whitelisting enabled, they are required to whitelist the whole IP range that belongs to Bitbucket Pipelines. Considering the fact that both repositories in question belong to the same *premium workspace,* Can't the IP whitelisting feature be overridden in such cases? Or, could there be an option to just whitelist a set of repositories?
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Enable IP whitelisting on the workspace 'ABC'
 * Go to repo 'A' and configure pipelines to clone the repo 'B'. Both repo 'A' and 'B' belongs to workspace 'ABC'
 * The pipeline will error out with the following error: "{color:#ff8b00}_To access this repository, an admin must whitelist your IP._{color}"

h3. Expected Results
 * Both repositories are part of the same workspace, therefore cloning another repo from the same workspace should be allowed and IP whitelisting check should be overridden.

h3. Actual Results
 * The user is required to add the Bitbucket pipelines IP range to the IP whitelisting section before cloning another repo within pipelines on the same workspace.

h3. Workaround
 * To add the Bitbucket pipelines IP range to the IP whitelisting section
 ** 
{code:java}
34.199.54.113/32
34.232.25.90/32
34.232.119.183/32
34.236.25.177/32
35.171.175.212/32
52.54.90.98/32
52.202.195.162/32
52.203.14.55/32
52.204.96.37/32
34.218.156.209/32
34.218.168.212/32
52.41.219.63/32
35.155.178.254/32
35.160.177.10/32
34.216.18.129/32
{code}
fields.summary: API and Git operations made within Pipelines build is blocked by IP whitelisting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When a user adds their approval to a PR, an event is shown for this in the respective PR activity.

If the same user removes their approval, instead of adding an extra event that will show this removal, the event created previously is removed.

This can be confusing for users in the following situations:
* There is a merge check on the destination branch of the PR to check for at least 2 approvals, and merge is prevented with unresolved merge checks.
* User A adds their approval to the PR (this creates event A in PR activity)
* User B adds their approval to the PR (this creates event B in PR activity)
* The PR is merged
* Then, user A removes their approval. When this happens, event A gets removed from PR activity

This can be confusing for users, who may think that the merge checks were not enforced and the PR was merged with only 1 approval.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be useful in this case not to remove event A, but create a new event when user A removes his approvals, that indicates so.

This way, users can see in the PR history that the approval was first added and then removed.
fields.summary: Show an event when an approval is removed from a PR, in the PR activity

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to change the settings of a project as the changes aren't reflected. 
The "owner" field remains empty in the form which could be the reason. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an existing project.
 # Go to the project settings.
 # Make changes to the repository settings such as Uncheck the "This is a private project" checkbox and save the change.
 # Go back to Project Settings and we see that the change is not reflected.

h3. Expected Results

When you uncheck the "This is a private project" checkbox and save the change, the project should become public.
h3. Actual Results

The project access does not change to public.

h3. Workaround

1st Option:
Use Bitbucket API call [/2.0/teams/{username}/projects/{project_key}|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/teams/%7Busername%7D/projects/%7Bproject_key%7D#put] to update the project settings.
eg. 
{code}
curl -sL -u <username>:<passweord> PUT https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/teams/<team_name>/projects/<PROJECT>  --header 'content-type: application/json' --data '{
	"key": "NPN",
	"name": "New Project Name"
}'
{code}

2nd Option:
 # Create a new public project with the correct settings
 # Add the repositories to the new project.
 # Please note that even though the project is public, if the project has private repositories, you do not see them in public view. You need to update the repository's access as well to public.
fields.summary: Unable to update the project settings as changes are not refelcted

fields.description:
Hi ~

 

I trying deploy micro-services with multiples container in same bitbucket repository. I kind of run into same situation posted in this reddit post.

[https://www.reddit.com/r/devops/comments/9udhp8/how_to_adopt_gitlab_flow_for_microservices/]

For some newly added features, only some of the container will be modify, and I would like to avoid all container build again in "build" step (Noticed that there could be control over branches, but controlling step within the branch ? ).

 

In gitlab, +*Its allow some sort "if else / only except" on variables or directory to control execution of job (step in bitbucket)*+ so that it could avoid container that need not re-build again and hence avoid wasting build time.

[https://docs.gitlab.com/ee/ci/yaml/#rules]

Run manually if {{Dockerfile}} has changed
{quote}docker build:

    script: docker build -t my-image:$CI_COMMIT_REF_SLUG .

    rules:

      - changes:

        - Dockerfile

        when:manual{color:#172b4d} {color}
{quote}
Is there already such feature ? if not, would it be on product roadmap ? Looking forward to reply, cheers !

 

p.s. Document for "[*skip ci]" definitely need renew !*
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipeline Add "rules" / "only-except" for better step control, like in gitlab CICD

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As a reviewer, I want to be able to mark each individual file in a PR as reviewed or not reviewed so that I can distinguish between what I've already seen, and what needs my attention.

 

Extra use cases: 

As a reviewer, I want files that are marked as reviewed to be reset to "unreviewed" when a commit changes that particular file, so that I can focus on new incremental changes.
fields.summary: Marking Files as Reviewed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a user tries to rename an existing project the project name change is saved temporarily. However when navigating away, the recently changed project name reverts back to the name originally provided upon creation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the Bitbucket dashboard click on Projects (Left navigation panel)
 # Select a project
 # Click on the project settings 
 # Edit the project name
 # Click save project
 # Navigate away
 # Go back to the list of projects
 # The project name does not reflect changes. Reverts back to the original name

h3. Expected Results

The project name should reflect the changes made.
h3. Actual Results

No changes are reflected. Project name reverts back to the original name
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Renaming a Bitbucket project reverts back to original project name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Markdown Link is not working as expected in Bitbucket
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Bitbucket Cloud, go to Issues > Create Issue.
 # Give issue title.
 # In the issue description enter the below markdown text.
 [message://%3ckenaf27892@tmail1.com%3e](message://%3ckenaf27892@tmail1.com%3e)
 # Firstly it does not get converted to a link automatically. When you delete the last Parenthesis '*)*' and type it instead, it gets converted to a link. Save the issue now.
 # After saving the issue, the resulting link has a missing value for the href attribute. It does not point to the correct link.

h3. Expected Results

The resulting link should point to the correct URL
h3. Actual Results

The resulting link does not point to the correct URL. 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Markdown Link is not working as expected in Bitbucket

fields.description:
Currently, in Bitbucket Pipelines caching dependency feature, we cache the docker layers generated in the build. 

It would be useful to be able to save the image name and tag of the docker image so that a user could know which cache is for which image. This is in a scenario where there are different docker images being used in the cache.
fields.summary: Pipelines : Save image name and tag information when caching docker layers

fields.description:
It would be good to allow user code to clone namespaces for cases such as when developers use headless Chrome inside Docker to develop apps.

At the moment, it is possible to workaround this limitation by running Chrome without sandboxing. Howevr, running Chrome without sandboxing may end up being more dangerous to Bitbucket pipeline multi-tenant environment, than allowing user code to clone namespaces.
fields.summary: Allow user code to clone namespaces

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to raise the number of build minutes that we provide for accounts on the free plan from 50 to 100.

The reason why this feature request was raised is that, 50 build minutes, in some cases, is not enough for a whole month, and users on the free plan usually are building software that will not generate any profit, so usually these users will not buy build minutes, rendering it impossible to continue building.
fields.summary: Raise number of Pipelines build minutes from 50 to 100 on the free plan

fields.description:
The *atlassian/default-image:2* image currently already contains *unzip* binary.
It would be great that it also contains the corresponding *zip* package that is useful for creating deployment artifacts during build process.
fields.summary: Add zip into atlassian/default-image:2 image

fields.description:
Some customers are frequently creating repos that sometimes stuck in creating state.

*Feature Request*: It would be best if we could have a feature to allow customers to delete their repo that was stuck in creating state on their end.
fields.summary: Allow deletion of repository that was stuck in creating state

fields.description:
Could you please make that  box down dynamic and when person changes from git to ssh , the text generated down needs to change dynamically. It's 2-3 lines of javascript, but could save 3-4 seconds of copy pasting it in command line . And that save would be to milions of developers out there. Thank you. 

 

 

 

 

!image-2019-11-24-03-15-26-128.png!
fields.summary: Save Bilions of Seconds of Developers life with small change

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket UI and API call only display the *Project* name, the *Key* of each project and its *Description*.

We would like to have additional information on that page/APIs such as:
# The number of repositories
# The total size of the repositories
# The last date that any repository under the referred project was updated.
# The name of the repositories.
fields.summary: Provide additional information regarding each Project owned by our team on the UI/API

fields.description:
The pull request page has a "Files changed" section where the changes for all the commits of the pull request are displayed.

It would be be really useful to be able to view the files changed for only one commit, so that we can comments on the pull request itself.

As part of our workflow, we respond to reviews/comments by adding additional commits to the branch that is opened in the pull request. We then view the new changes in the pull request and comments again if necessary. It is currently very difficult to view the changes of the additional commits and add comments for those on the pull request itself.



While we can view the specific changes for one commit (through the commit tab or through the activity tab), we want to add new comments on the pull request, not the commit.

A good example of that is in GitHub:
!image-2019-11-22-16-58-38-678.png!
fields.summary: Add ability to select a specific commit to review in a pull request's Files changed

fields.description:
Hi Team,

Please consider this as a feature request. It would be good to have an option to choose whether to have the "changeset" comments on issues to be interpreted as Markdown or not. 

This would help customers who do not prefer using Markdown, use the issue tracker normally. And it would help the users who want to use Markdown.

Kindly Assist,
Regards
Manu Abraham
fields.summary: Option to block Markdown usage in Bitbucket UI Issues Comment

fields.description:
Hello Team,

Currently Bitbucket server has a column to view issues in the Commit section. Customer would like the same feature to be implemented in Bitbucket Cloud.

!image-2019-11-22-20-57-29-467.png!

Kindly check into this, have a wonderful day!
Regards
Manu Abraham
fields.summary: Issue Column in Bitbucket Commit UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Using the mouse wheel button, click and drag doesn't work on Bitbucket Files. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open any Bitbucket file and try to click and drag the mouse wheel, nothing happens (see attached). 

h3. Expected Results
* It should work like any other Bitbucket page. 

h3. Actual Results
* When clicking at the mouse wheel, nothing happens. 

h3. Workaround
* Use the scroll without clicking.
fields.summary: Scrolling with mouse wheel click and drag doesn't work on Bitbucket Files

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When clicking on page numer of "Users on plan" view in workspace settings of Bitbucket Cloud the error page is loaded saying "Something went wrong"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have access to workspace with more than 50 users
 # Go to https://bitbucket.org/<workspace_key>/workspace/settings/plan-users/ (replace <workspace_key> with key of the workspace with more than 50 users)
 # Scroll down the page and click "2" on page list

h3. Expected Results
Page 2 loads
URL is https://bitbucket.org/<workspace_key>/workspace/settings/plan-users/?page=2

h3. Actual Results
"Something went wrong" error page is displayed
URL is https://bitbucket.org/account/user/<user_key>/plan-users/?page=2

 !Screenshot 2019-11-22 at 12.00.44.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use direct URL: https://bitbucket.org/<workspace_key>/workspace/settings/plan-users/?page=<page_number>
fields.summary: Switching pages of "Users on plan" view in workspace settings results in error page

fields.description:
Hi Team,

This is a feature request regarding Branch Model. Currently, if a branch that is part of a branch model is deleted, it will cause problems such as:
 # Unable to Load branches and tags from commits page
 # Unable to load branches while creating new branches.

To fix this, we have to manually remove the deleted branch from the branch model and replace with an existing branch. 

 A suggestion here is to provide a notification (or a block) while a branch that is part of the branch model is deleted/changed in some way that would set the branch model as invalid branch. 
 !image-2019-11-22-02-29-47-545.png|thumbnail! 

Ideally, this would help the customers understand that they have deleted a branch that is part of the branch model and they can refrain/replace immediately.

Kindly assist. 
Regards
Manu Abraham
fields.summary: Block/Notify When Branch Model Branches are deleted

fields.description:
At this moment, any user with _read_ access to a repository can open a commit page and have it approved through the _Approve_ button.
 !Approve Button.PNG|thumbnail! 

It would be good to have the ability to disable the approve button to set of users while keeping it enabled for other users.
fields.summary: Disable approve commit feature for a set of users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The approval commit listed on a pull request's activity tab for pull requests to merge content between forks points to the main repository instead of the forked one, resulting in a 404 error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Fork a repository
# Make changes on the forked repository
# Create a pull request to merge the forked content to the main repository
# approve the pull request
# go to the pull request's Activity tab
# click on the commit's hash link for the approval step

h3. Expected Results
Commit link points to the forked repository.

h3. Actual Results
Commit link points to the main repository.
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-20 at 17.35.48.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-11-20 at 17.35.38.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Approval commit listed on a pull request's activity tab points to the wrong repository

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When I search "backend.tu.ts.egym.coffee" in the Bitbucket code search I retrieve inline code result that matched the string as shown in the screenshot 1.png

When I change the search to "tu.ts.egym.coffee" I retrieve only files whose name has "tu.ts.egym.coffee", it does not show the file which has words that match tu.ts.egym.coffee
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the code search, search for  *backend.tu.ts.egym.coffee*, it will show the file which has the string backend.tu.ts.egym.coffee. See screenshot 1.png
 # If you search for *tu.ts.egym.coffee*, it shows only files whose name has tu.ts.egym.coffee, but not the file which has the string backend.tu.ts.egym.coffee
 See screenshot 2.png

h3. Expected Results

When you search for *tu.ts.egym.coffee*, it should show files whose name has tu.ts.egym.coffee and also the file which has the string backend.tu.ts.egym.coffee 
h3. Actual Results

When you search for *tu.ts.egym.coffee*, it shows only files whose name has tu.ts.egym.coffee, but not the file which has the string backend.tu.ts.egym.coffee 
h3. Workaround

1. Search for *tu\.ts\.egym\.coffee* instead of *tu.ts.egym.coffee*, ** it works as expected.

See screenshot 3.png

2. for the syntax with Class1.Class2RRRR, we suggest using the same syntax as a phrase search, in the following way: "Class1 Class2" this should help with finding the results you are looking for until our team addresses this issue.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in Code search

fields.description:
Ideal behaviour - Once a pull request is merged, in my opinion the merge option(button) should be disabled.

Current Behaviour - But this has been witnessed that merge option remains enabled even after one of the reviewer has already merged the pull request.

To be noted - Multiple reviewers involved.

Expected Change - Merge button should be disabled once a pull request is merged.
fields.summary: Merge option enabled even after the pull request is merged once.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Emojis such as :thumbsup: added to commit messages are not rendered on Bitbucket's commits page while using Firefox. The emojis are rendered as expected using Chrome.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make changes to a repository
 # Commit the changes to Bitbucket, including an emoji on the commit message
 # Access the repository commits page ([https://bitbucket.org/]<username>/<repo_slug>/commits/)

h3. Expected Results

Emoji being rendered on the commit message:
 * !Screen Shot 2019-11-19 at 14.28.18.png|width=627,height=188,thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results

Emoji is not rendered on the commit message:
 * !Screen Shot 2019-11-19 at 14.19.03.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Emojis on commit messages are not rendered on commits page using Firefox.

fields.description:
Right now, we can use {{after-script}} if a step is failed or success.
However, there's no way to stop the Pipelines build from the {{after-script}}.

*Feature request*: It would be best if we could have a way to stop a Pipelines build by calling some commands inside the YAML file.
fields.summary: Conditionally Stop Pipelines build

fields.description:

Improve logs when changing destination branch from a Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, in Bitbucket Cloud, any repo/team admin can remove the access from other admins, or from the 'Administrators' group of the repo. It would be useful to have a "non-removable" admin. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

NA
h3. Expected Results

If an admin is marked as non-removable, other admins should not be able to remove his access.
h3. Actual Results

Currently, any repo admin can remove access from other admins.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Need a feature to set an admin as non-removable

fields.description:
Show the list of projects that a repository belongs to in the repository view in Bitbucket UI.

For example:
 !image-2019-11-18-21-07-48-739.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show project containing repository

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users would like to be able to accept an invitation from Bitbucket website.

Sometimes, users don't receive invitation emails because there was a hard bounce event and their email was placed in a suppression list. In this case, they need to contact support to get their email removed from the suppression list, and then ask for the invitation to be resent, which may take some time.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allowing users to accept an invitation from the website would mean that those users could get access faster the the content they need to work on.
fields.summary: Allow users to accept invitations from Bitbucket website

fields.description:
Currently, if you have a PR trigger and you named your PR as "Master", although there's the icon identification, it becomes confusing to determine whether if a Pipelines build is triggered by branch or PR.

 !pipelines_trigger_indicator.png|thumbnail! 

*Feature request*: It would best if we could clearly indicate if a Pipelines build is triggered by branch or PR trigger. Maybe we could add the number of PR before the name of the PR.
fields.summary: Pipelines Trigger Indication

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users cannot enable pipeline with the Branch permissions on for the main branch. This is because when the pipelines is enabled, Bitbucket tries to commit for bitbucketpipeline.yml file and looks for the same in the location of the main branch. Given that users have enabled branch permissions preventing such an action, pipelines ceases to be enabled.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1: Enable branch permissions from the Repository settings
 # Step 2: Now, try to enable pipeline from the repository settings

h3. Actual Results

The pipeline cannot be enabled 

h3. Expected Results

The pipeline should be enabled or throw an error message to help users identify what is the error related to and how they can fix the same.

The below exception is thrown :
{color:red}The UI will just send the error message "Something went wrong".{color}

h3. Workaround

The workaround for now would be to disable the branch permissions and enable the pipelines post which the branch permissions can be enabled
fields.summary: Cannot Enable Pipelines with Branch Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
tar.gz files downloaded from Bitbucket have a different checksum than when it was imported.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a tar.gz file locally, check for its checksum
 # Import the files in the Bitbucket Downloads section of a repository
 # Download the same file imported, re-check the checksum

h3. Expected Results

The checksum of unaltered files should remain the same when downloaded from Bitbucket.

h3. Actual Results

The checksum differs when a tar.gz file is downloaded.

h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Checksum mismatch for tar.gz files downloaded through Bitbucket
